author: Staff Reporter
text:
FIRs were filed against him for allegedly aiding Veerappan

The Madras High Court on Monday dismissed an appeal moved by the State government against the order acquitting Kolathur Mani against whom criminal proceedings were initiated for allegedly aiding sandalwood smuggler Veerappan.

According to the prosecution, FIRs were registered against Mr. Mani by the Thalavadi police in 2000 and Vellithirupur police in 1998 for allegedly helping Veerappan.

But the Judicial Magistrate, Mettur Dam, through an order dated December 6, acquitted Mr. Mani from all the criminal proceedings. Challenging the order the government approached the High Court.

When the appeal came up for hearing on Monday, Justice A. Selvam refused to concur with the prosecution and dismissed the plea.

title: Government plea against Kolathur Mani dismissed
